H0.text: Cytosol is the jellylike substance in which subcellular components are suspended in all cells.

H1.text: Glycerol is the jellylike substance in which subcellular components are suspended in all cells.

H2.text: Plasma is the jellylike substance in which subcellular components are suspended in all cells.

H3.text: Cortisol is the jellylike substance in which subcellular components are suspended in all cells.

A4.text: The term cytosol is now used to refer to the liquid phase of the cytoplasm in an intact cell.

A5.text: The cytosol is thus a liquid matrix around the organelles.
